item.title: Brittney add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I know now, Lord, why you utter no answer. You are yourself the answer. Before your face questions die away. What other answer would suffice?" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Jonathan Sacks
item.description: "Peace can be agreed around the conference table, but unless it grows in ordinary hearts and minds, it does not last. It may not even begin" -- Jonathan Sacks

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, 'Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous?' Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory of God that is within us. It's not just in some of us; it's in everyone. And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Jonathan Sacks
item.description: "Just as the natural environment depends on biodiversity, so the human environment depends on cultural diversity, because no one civilization encompasses all the spiritual, ethical and artistic expressions of mankind." -- Jonathan Sacks

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Sire, you are looking at a plain man, and I am looking at a great man. Each of us may benefit." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "No army can withstand the strength of an idea whose time has come." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "Of all treasures of knowledge, the most vital is the knowledge of God, his existence, powers, love, and promises." -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "O timid one, awaken, exert yourself, draw back the curtains your training and background have hung over the windows of your soul." -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you until it seems that you cannot hold on for a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time when the tide will turn." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Pindar.
item.description: "Youth is a blossom whose fruit is love; happy is he who plucks it after watching it slowly ripen." -- Pindar.

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Dean Madsen
item.description: "The human spirit is greater than any oppression that can be brought against it." -- Dean Madsen

item.title: Brittney add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Persuasive influences are better than any amount of moralizing." -- Louisa May Alcott
